title.narrative: BF - DPO - Growth and Compet. Credit 4

description.narrative: The program development objectives (PDOs) of the Fourth Growth and Competitiveness Credit (GCC-4) Operation Project for Burkina Faso are to enhance the government's ability to: (a) reduce costs in the agriculture and transport sectors; (b) improve transparency and accountability in public resource mobilization and management; and (c) reduce vulnerability to shocks. This program document presents the fourth and last operation in a programmatic series of GCC designed to support the Government of Burkina Faso initially during the 2012-2014 period, and extended to 2015. The GCC-4 is a single-tranche disbursement of United States (U.S.) 100 million dollars equivalent, 50 percent in the form of an International Development Association (IDA) grant, and 50 percent as an IDA credit provided on standard IDA terms. The GCC-4 is fully consistent with the Bank's twin goals of ending extreme poverty by 2030 and promoting shared prosperity by increasing the incomes of the poorest 40 percent of the population. The reforms supported by the proposed fourth GCC operation aim at creating a dynamic and diversified private sector capable of transforming high growth rates into broad-based improvements in income earning opportunities.

title.narrative: Capitalization of the input fund is at least 10 billion CFAF (billion CFAF)
Public revenue generated by the mining sector is increased to 4% of GDP.(in percentage of GDP)
Percent of budget for decentralized communities(in percentage of national budget)
Average waiting time for customs clearance in Ouaga Inter reduced by 50 percent.(number of days)
Capitalization of the stabilization fund is at least 6 billion CFAF(billion CFAF).
The Support Fund for Women's Income-Generating Activities (FAARF) reaches over 80,000 beneficiaries nationwide, with a total loan portfolio of more than CFAF 4.5 billion.
The national food reserve and emergency food stocks are increase to at least 50,000 and 10,000 tons, respectively (tons metrics)
